list_definition.definition: to roll or fold (round something or someone)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He wrapped his handkerchief round his bleeding finger.

list_definition.definition: to cover by folding or winding something round

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She wrapped the book (up) in brown paper
She wrapped the baby up in a warm shawl.

list_definition.definition: a warm covering to put over one’s shoulders.

list_ex_of_english: Dishes were wrapped with plastic film to reduce the rate of water loss.
The collecting tubes in the cercarial body are composed of cells that are wrapped around the lumen.
The cocoon was covered with shrink-wrapped plastic, and wrapped with masking tape to form the spool.
The shape and size of the central object suggest that it is a stela, and it appears to be wrapped with bands of tied cloth.
Like the proximal capillaries, they were composed of large flattened cells wrapped around the lumen.
We can explain the discipline in terms of solidity, and assume that human agency wraps itself around the real.
A wrapped operation also calls the old operation, and wraps the result into a node with a new identity tag.
Two layers of flannel were wrapped round the cylinder and the seam pulled tight.
